text:
IGNACIO LARTIRIGOYEN:
I was raised
in a rural town in Argentina.

As I spend a lot of time
playing outside the house

and spending all
the day in the farm,

I developed a passion
for agribusiness.

My father, he's an
agricultural entrepreneur.

Like, our family
conversations, we

would talk a lot
about agriculture.

So after I graduated from the
university, most of my career,
I worked in agribusiness.

I have a passion for
producing and supplying food
to the world.
[MUSIC PLAYING]

I knew that I needed
some tools to take
my career to a new level.

I was taking a lot of
decisions with intuition.

I decided that I wanted
a more formal business

education but with a
practical point of view.

So HBS, for me, was
the perfect place.

When I applied to HBS, I was a
bit concerned at the beginning.

Because in the statistics,
I didn't see agribusiness.

So it was a background
that was not common at all.

But I think that HBS
really appreciated
a different background.

The first time I
came to HBS, when

I saw the trees, the buildings,
and the people interacting,

I thought, this
place is amazing.
I want to be here.

It is a different culture,
different lifestyle, too.

What is surprising
me is that my kids

are starting to talk in
English between them.
There are my kids.

(LAUGHING) They are
coming right now.

For me, that I was raised
in a very small town,

I didn't have the opportunity
to interact with diverse people.

The diversity that they
have in their environment
is something unique.

It's one of the best things
of the HBS experience.

My wife, [? Anna, ?]
she's very happy, too.

She is really enjoying
the experience.
Partners are integrated to HBS.

They are considered in
part of the section.

Both of us, we are very
happy with our lives here.

You have to be really open
to challenge core assumptions

that you have and to allow other
people to challenge your ideas.

The more open you
are, the more you

will get out of the
entire experience.

So I think this ability to
reflect is really important

and is something that
I will take out of HBS.

What I want to do in the
future is work in agribusiness

in Argentina, make an
impact on the country

by contributing to
improving the supply chains.

I would also like to make
an impact on social issues

in Argentina, on
malnutrition or on education,

that are two topics that
I am passionate about.
We have a lot of work to do.

Some people make the assumption
that they won't get in,
so they don't apply.

And I think that
is a big mistake.
HBS is a place for everybody.

Regardless of where
you are coming from,
you have chances to get in here.

The university likes
diverse backgrounds

and really appreciates
different experiences.
[SPEAKING SPANISH]
Thank you.
SPEAKER: Great job.
IGNACIO LARTIRIGOYEN: Thank you.
Thank you.
SPEAKER: Yay, you did it!
[CLAPPING]
[LAUGHTER]
[MUSIC PLAYING]
